organization.fullName: The University of Texas Health Science Center at San Antonio

identificationModule.briefTitle: Radiographic Changes in the Maxillary Sinus Following Closed Sinus Augmentation
identificationModule.officialTitle: Radiographic Changes in the Maxillary Sinus Following Closed Sinus Augmentation

leadSponsor.name: The University of Texas Health Science Center at San Antonio

descriptionModule.briefSummary: A closed sinus augmentation is performed for dental implant placement.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: Patients who are diagnosed as needing sinus augmentation by a closed approach for dental implant placement will be recruited. A cone beam computed tomography (CBCT) study is the standard of care prior to dental implant placement. However, following closed sinus augmentation nothing is known as to the extent of augmentation in the medial to lateral (cross-sectional) dimension. Patients will have a low volume CBCT taken immediately postsurgically, and again at the six-month postoperative visit to determine the dimensional changes in the augmentation. These images will be compared to standard periapical radiographs at the same time points.

designInfo.interventionModelDescription: A 2 arm study using two methods of imaging in a participant

armGroups.label: Low volume CBCT
armGroups.description: Radiographic low volume cone beam computed tomography used to plan implant placement

armGroups.label: Standard periapical radiographs
armGroups.description: Standard radiography used to plan implant placement

interventions.name: 3D R100 scanner
interventions.description: A cone beam computed tomography used for planning of implant surgery

interventions.name: Conventional Radiograph
interventions.description: Imaging used as standard of care to plan for implant surgery

primaryOutcomes.description: Determine the morphologic changes to maxillary sinus anatomy three dimensionally when a closed sinus augmentation is performed for dental implant placement at 8mm from alveolar crest.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline immediately postoperatively and at 6 months

primaryOutcomes.description: Determine the morphologic changes to maxillary sinus anatomy three dimensionally when a closed sinus augmentation is performed for dental implant placement at 10 mm from alveolar crest.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline immediately postoperatively and at 6 months

primaryOutcomes.description: Determine the morphologic changes to maxillary sinus anatomy three dimensionally when a closed sinus augmentation is performed for dental implant placement at 12 mm from alveolar crest.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline immediately postoperatively and at 6 months

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

1. Partially edentulous patients (18-85 years of age) requiring maxillary sinus augmentation for dental implant placement.
2. At least 5mm of native bone below the maxillary sinus.
3. Nonsmokers.
4. If diabetic, current HbA1C \<7.0 (less than or equal to 7.0)

Exclusion Criteria:

1. Maxillary sinus disease.
2. Pregnancy or attempting to become pregnant.
3. Diseases that affect bone metabolism.
4. Use of medications known to affect bone metabolism.
5. Tobacco use.
6. Alcoholism or recreational drug use.
7. Diabetic with HbA1C \>7.0 (above 7.0)

ipdSharingStatementModule.description: All deidentified participant data will be shared with colleagues
